summary: This is an FBI Public Affairs News Briefing dated September 23, 2020, covering a wide range of national and international news. It includes a brief mention that a judge is keeping alive an effort to unseal FBI files on Jeffrey Epstein, and reports on various criminal investigations, including child pornography and sex trafficking cases.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Disgraced financier, subject of FBI files
persons.context: Mentioned in a news item about a judge allowing a public records lawsuit to continue, seeking the release of FBI documents about him, including his time as a government informant.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Accused of procuring underage girls for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Reportedly dined with Bill Clinton in 2014, according to a news item in the briefing.

persons.name: Angela Clemente
persons.context: Sued to force the FBI to release documents on Jeffrey Epstein; her lawsuit was allowed to continue by a federal judge.

persons.name: Judge Trevor N. McFadden
persons.context: Presided over the status hearing for Angela Clemente's public-records lawsuit seeking FBI files on Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Reportedly dined with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2014, according to a news item.

persons.name: Jerry Harris
persons.context: Subject of an FBI investigation over child pornography charges; the FBI is seeking possible victims.

persons.name: Chase McMillon
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking; federal prosecutors are investigating a decade-old allegation involving him and an underage girl.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Quoted in multiple news stories regarding opioid busts and receiving letters from House Republicans.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Announced takedowns under Operation LeGend in multiple cities.

connections.description: Maxwell is accused of procuring underage girls for sex-trafficker Epstein.
Reportedly attended an intimate dinner together in 2014.
Clemente is suing to force the FBI to release documents about Epstein.

events.title: Judge Allows Epstein FOIA Lawsuit to Continue
events.description: A federal judge kept alive a public records lawsuit seeking to force the FBI to release tens of thousands of documents about Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Bill Clinton Dines with Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: After a gala in Los Angeles, Bill Clinton attended an intimate dinner that included Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: FBI Seeks Victims in Jerry Harris Case
events.description: The FBI Chicago Field Office announced it is seeking the public's help in finding possible victims in the investigation of actor Jerry Harris over child pornography charges.

events.title: Decade-Old Allegation Holds Up Sex Trafficking Case
events.description: Federal prosecutors are investigating a decade-old allegation involving sex trafficking of a then-underage girl, holding up the resolution of a Bay Area human trafficking case against Chase McMillon.

keyFacts: A judge allowed a Freedom of Information Act lawsuit seeking the release of FBI files on Jeffrey Epstein to proceed.
The briefing reports that Bill Clinton dined with Ghislaine Maxwell in 2014.
The FBI is investigating actor Jerry Harris for child pornography and seeking potential victims.
A decade-old sex trafficking allegation is holding up a California case and may lead to new charges.
The document is a broad news briefing covering many topics, with only a few direct references to the Epstein case.
